direction.raw_text: . LIMBO RADIO 1 He is 20, normal looking, not too nebbish, punkish, bookish, or stylish. He is a high-strung guy, enjoying a rare moment of un-self-consciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an old joke. It comes from "The Iliad," but I think it was popularized by Oscar Wilde. It goes like this: ...A bear's taking a shit, like, out in the woods one day. And he sees this rabbit, also taking a shit. The rabbit, wait, I mean, the bear, he's shitting up a storm, cuz he's been eating Mexican. The wiping's taking forever, and his shit keeps sticking to his fur. Wait, what happens next? Oh, right-- he asks the rabbit if he ever has trouble wiping. The rabbit says no, shit just slides right off him. So the bear picks the rabbit up and wipes his ass with him. (pause, as if for applause) Well, I never said it was a good joke. And see, that makes it perfect, because it's pretty much the story of my life. We can now see that he's perched on a stool, wearing a REM t- shirt and old jeans. He gesticulates vaguely as he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Growing up, my parents were huge Woody Allen fans. Still are. Personally, I hate him. Same thing with the Beatles, such a part of my background that I must have been about 16 by the time I realized how useless it was to rebel by ignoring the Beatles or any other cultural artifact of their generation. Even if I did spend my childhood hearing my father go on and on about how, like, Nirvana would never mean anything because they're not the Beatles, blah-blah. I don't know, this is all starting to sound a little bit too angsty, you know, and that's about the last thing I'm going for here... Shit, I really got off track there, didn't I? As Max shakes his head, a hanging RADIO MIKE comes into view. It has the call letters of a college radio station on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . High on the wall behind him, a glowing "ON AIR" light is revealed. The perspective is skewed, the studio appears cavernous and completely barren.

direction.raw_text: I hope he's a better dancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, this is the side you show, playing everything off as a joke whenever things gets serious. But there's more to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ever tell you about the bear and the rabbit in the woods--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick. Now. Tell me something about yourself, something I never would have guessed. And don't even try to come up with some witty retort. Max, agape, is on the spot, helpless. Julie grabs her coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should get going. She stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. She sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Okay. (a deep breath) We barely know each other, but you're all I think about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off-balance, covering) I said something I never would have guessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, thanks. I bare my soul and now you're the funny one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. That wasn't quite what I was looking for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it's your turn, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see. Okay, here's one: I have a boyfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck. I sure hadn't guessed that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, well, not anymore. Eric and I were together in high school, but we broke up over break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since high school, wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. He's kind of a jerk. It was all a waste of time. Sometimes I, I, I don't know, Max, why don't you have a girlfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the spot) Uh, I have a friend who says it's because I watch Annie Hall too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. That film practically raised me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it has a very positive message, too. I wish more guys were into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful what you wish for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know what I'm wishing for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snowtires?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max, there are a lot of girls that would go for a guy like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know any?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is one of those moments, in a movie, when a character has a chance to say something, and of course they do, and it's perfect, and it becomes a movie moment. Julie starts to lean in. Suddenly, the BUILDING MANAGER walks in. He's a dead ringer for Woody Allen. Max starts violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Building's closing. Everyone out. He exits. Max is beside himself. Julie sees that the moment's over and gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you hungry at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. I know this place. Their food is bad, but they compensate by being overpriced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds perfect. They walk out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, did that guy look like...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ernest Borgnine? Yeah, I noticed that too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JULIE'S CAR -- NIGHT 47 Max is relaxed and chatting while Julie drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been able to do it since high school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a scary gift. I mean, even if people are destined to break up, the will to stay together is very powerful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the real tragedy. Look at all the unhappy couples in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if your gift is really that special, Max. I mean, we break up with everyone we ever date... Until the one we stay with forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See how ridiculous dating is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you get this attitude if you love Annie Hall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? That's what Annie's all about. Julie looks dubious. Max flicks on the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..."college radio for the masses," and that's it for me. (sound of CDs falling) Whoops! Anyway, next up is Verbal Diarrhea, with Todd Duke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is your radio set to the campus station?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, it's stuck on it. It's how I first heard your show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought Beth told you about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter, Max. Now that I've met you, your show's not important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PRETENTIOUS CAFE  A LITTLE LATER 48 The kind of place that's perfect for Parents Weekend. At this late hour, it is filled with young professionals. There's a dance floor, where couples dance to the standards. Max and Julie are at a table in the corner, looking out of place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a nice place. Ritzy. Interesting mix of people here, you've got these men with their suits, taking their waitress girlfriends out to impress them into bed, because they can't get them any other way. Really, as if a fast car can ever make up for a small dick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it did, do you think I'd be here? I'd be down at the Porsche dealer with a ski mask and an Uzi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys, always obsessed with dick size.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sure, there's that, but it would also be nice to have a car with a heater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's guess which couples are destined to break up. How about them? Indicates a COUPLE dancing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I can't tell just by looking. I need some info. Their waitress, DONNA, arrives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi! Do you have a boyfriend? Max is aghast. Donna stares a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you need to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, just a description.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Describe him for us. It's okay, I'm a psyche major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's tall... ish. Brown hair. Funny. Very friendly. Fixes cars. Close with his brother. Uh, what else? Believes in God. Has a sweet tooth. Uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's plenty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So can I take your order?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not ready, thanks. Donna puts her pad away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what was that all about then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max here thinks you're going to break up with your boyfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. It's all in there. You qualified "tall" so as not to make him appear too handsome, said "friendly" like a euphemism, chose "fixes cars" instead of the more dignified "auto mechanic," and finally, mentioned his brother a propos of nothing, like you're threatened by him. The waitress looks like she's been slapped. After a pause, she turns her back and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Don't shoot the messenger!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm such an idiot. She's going to shit in our food now. I can't believe you asked her that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, we're all people here, right? If you want to talk to someone, talk to them. I don't spend my time trying to justify talking to people or whatever. You limit yourself if you do that. If you spend too much time worrying, you don't spend enough time living, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, a fortune cookie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to keep yourself open to possibilities in life. I'm the first one in my family to go to college. Sometimes I can't believe I'm here, at a semi- prestigious university getting a halfway- decent education-- this has always been my dream. How did you end up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a coupon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you mean, financial aid is a bitch. And the university experience itself is kind of disappointing. All those rich students with no idea how lucky they are. But I don't think about them. I think about me, I think about where I want to be someday: a world traveler, running some huge company, or, you know, doing some fantastically important work. And when the day comes that I can relax, I'm going to charter a boat, sail around the world, and see the Seven Wonders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought they broke up when Stevie left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, aren't you curious about the world? Doesn't the sheer scope of life fill you with wonder?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonder, horror, it's such a fine line...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, Max... But she's smiling at him, and he can't help but return it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM -- NIGHT 49 Tommy sleeps while the TV proclaims golf products. Max comes in and quietly shuts it off. Tommy gurgles and rolls over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...swallowed a bug... Max goes to his room. Sam's bed is empty. He shakes his head, picks up a key from his desk, and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIMBO RADIO 50 Max sits on a stool, as in the beginning, but this time we are PUSHING IN...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes I look around and wonder where the hell my friends came from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM -- FLASHBACK 51 Tommy and Sam are in each other's faces, yelling. Tommy waves a book and Sam waves a newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Like, the other night Tommy and Sam nearly got into a fistfight over whether the X-Files is based on a true story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM -- FLASHBACK 52 Charles makes out with a GIRL in a stall covered in colored paper. She has a cigarette on a black holding stem, which brushes the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Before that, Scott covered the entire bathroom in multi-colored post-it notes, which Charles somehow set on fire, nearly getting us kicked out of housing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM -- FLASHBACK 53 Max, Sam, Scott, and Tommy are there, reading fanclub newsletters: X-philes, Font-ain of Youth, Men Are From Mars Women From Venus. Charles walks in, arm in arm with a woman who is obviously a PROFESSOR, and escorts her to his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) They're great friends. I feel safer among them than among my own family. [MORE]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) They always know what not to say, how not to make things uncomfortable. After a beat, the group resumes reading like nothing happened... except Max, who can't believe what he just saw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RADIO STATION (LIMBO) 54 Max in CLOSE-UP. Over his shoulder, images of Beth arguing with him from various moments in their history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even when Beth was part of the group, she didn't fit in. Like, she never just lets things be. She always has to know exactly what I'm thinking. It was sort of cute when we were friends, but now it's like a proctology exam. (SIGHS) Hard to imagine a friendship going more wrong. The image of Beth STOPS on a shot of her looking at him with undisguised disappointment. She DISSOLVES into a image of Julie, beaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, but Julie. Juliejuliejulie. She's smart, she's funny, isn't constantly hassling me. How she can stay such a dreamer is beyond me... Hey, I wonder if she's listening now. The thought stops him cold. The image over his shoulder
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: replaced with a plain cement wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RADIO STATION 55 We ZOOM OUT fast. Max is back in reality, the station crowded and claustrophobic. He tries to regroup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taps the mike) Hello? Uh, Julie...? (clears his throat) So, uh, as I was saying... Um. My friends. Yeah. My friends are weird. Shit. (LONG PAUSE) I think it's time for some music. He grabs for a CD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : white on black: "THURSDAY" 68.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . U.C. GENERAL STORE 56 Max and Charles stir their coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuckin' hate this flavored shit. Anyway, I can't believe the cat in the shag jacket was Andy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I knew him as a freshman, he was pre- law... Whew. Anyway, it sounds like things are going well between you and Julie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. This is a real change of pace. Staying away from Annie Hall is like some kind of magic trick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was wondering about that. You seem different lately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how when things are going badly, there are certain parts I like to watch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like how you spent your whole sophomore year watching that lobster scene on repeat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I realized that I don't know what part to watch when things are going well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I actually regret mentioning that theory. In fact, Sam and I were thinking of watching it tonight. You in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you on crack? I meet a girl I really like, that I may actually have a chance with, and you want me to put it all in jeopardy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Watching it without you would be weird. Unnatural. That film is you, Max, face it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's ruining my life. Charles drinks his coffee and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Max. I have to tell you something. I scored last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? The theory works for you, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With Beth. Max drops his coffee, thunderstruck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't premeditated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you sleep with Beth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, nobody knows about it. It won't happen again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happen again? Of course not! That might constitute a relationship! Max is at a loss. The CASHIER looks over suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Max. I wasn't sure if you'd care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care! Oh God, this is my fault! If only I hadn't called her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to say? I'm sorry, man. Let me pay for your coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've gotta be kidding. He starts to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going back to the suite?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno where I'm going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPUS THEATER  DAY 57 Max, distressed, passes the campus theater, where someone is tacking up a poster for Annie Hall. Max sees it and averts his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIDNEY BEAN -- DAY 58 He walks past the Kidney Bean. Something catches his eye through the window. He changes direction and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIDNEY BEAN -- DAY 59 Max sees Beth eating alone at a table, reading a Tom Robbins book. He walks over. Beth isn't thrilled to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max? What are you doing here? A sudden craving for bird-seed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I figured I'd had enough actual food this week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, be careful, someone in the corner is eating egg salad. Max sits down across from her. After an awkward pause:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reason. Something about you sounded different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, actually, last night on the... Oh no, he's here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I just left him in the General Store... But she isn't talking about Charles: she's looking across the room at STEVE, a good-looking guy who is talking to a GIRL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he with? He never calls me anymore. I think he might be seeing someone. Have you heard anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't even know him. What's so special about this guy, anyway? I mean, are you and he...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sort of. Well, no, I guess not. (DISTRACTED) I know something's going on. I'm such a fool. Why are we always attracted to people that are completely wrong for us? Is it because they excite us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess so. You know, we should try to be more exciting. Like the other day, I waited until the last minute before returning a video. And next time, I swear I'm not going to rewind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can be a rebel too. The other day I went to bed without flossing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, are we pathetic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, it's pathetic, but we're okay, you know? But sometimes, I feel like...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Me too. She puts on her coat and gathers her things on her tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you're here, Max. I didn't realize how much I missed you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel the same way about the Sex Pistols. Missing them is far cooler than having them around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not what I meant, Max. She heads for the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM -- EVENING 60 Sam looks dubiously at Max, who waves his arms and shouts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, you saw Julie with someone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just that. Nothing more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. They were having lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was he? What did he look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're over-reacting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could she see someone else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not even dating!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we might be! I can't handle competition, Sam, I'm not the competitive type.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was just lunch in the cafeteria. He looked completely normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't compete with that! (he fumbles with his coat) Man, it's all gone so wrong, so fast. He rushes out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DORM HALLWAY  SHELLY HALL 61 Max knocks on the door to Julie's suite. Nothing. He paces, frustrated. Suddenly, JUDY comes out of a stairwell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, do you know where Julie is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Are you Max?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh wow! You're just like she described. Hi, I'm Judy. I'm sure she mentions me all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, Judy. Right. Judy unlocks the door and holds it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in, come in. Make yourself at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JULIE'S SUITE 62 Max enters cautiously. The common room couldn't be more different than his own, clean and tasteful. Judy hangs her coat up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This may be completely inappropriate, but can I ask you something? The tattoo did it hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhhhh... No! I mean, not much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you use your frat's logo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, uh, the guy said it's too hard to draw two grown men kissing. Say, which one is Julie's room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the left. She's got the single. Max pushes Julie's door open with one hand while keeping an eye on the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...! Uh, do I come here often, would you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) What? The front door opens and Julie enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max! What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judy let me in! Judy comes out of her room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I think I'm going to get a tattoo, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judy, Mark has the tattoo. This is Max.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You're Max?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, isn't he great?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Glaring at him, she goes into her room and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a surprise! What brings you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was, uh, in the area and thought I'd pop in. Find out how your day went.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was excellent, how was yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. I had lunch with a dear, dear friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Anyone I know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably not. She's a foreign exchange student. Spends a lot of time modeling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, the agencies won't leave her alone. We had, uh, quite a lunch. Lots of shellfish, and wine. And, uh, rhino's horn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For lunch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yeah, uh, she's on the kosher meal plan. Look, I gotta go. Nice seeing you again. He splits, leaving Julie wondering what that was all about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JULIE'S DORM  NIGHT 63 Outside, Max beats himself in the forehead several times. Then, a picture of misery, he trudges off--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RADIO STATION 64 He walks in on someone doing a show. He leaves dejectedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM 65 He goes back to his suite, where Sam and Jen sit like statues, watching "The X-Files." He makes a quick exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JULIE'S DORM  NIGHT 66 Passes by Julie's dorm again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNIVERSITY CENTER  NIGHT 67 Eventually finds himself approaching the University Center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE PUB  NIGHT 68 A ska band plays "These Boots Were Made For Walking" before two small lines of skanking rude boys. Charles is alone at the bar. Max sits down beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just made an ass of myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, is it the weekend already?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha-ha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it. Your troubles don't compare. Sara blew up at Stacy and nearly destroyed our first rehearsal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you've got real problems. Do you have time to talk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh, here she comes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles! Can you believe Stacy at rehearsal?! She jumps on the stool next to him. Charles turns to Max for help but he's already gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : white on black: "FRIDAY" 69 INT. COMMON ROOM -- THE NEXT MORNING 69 Max plays video hockey. Charles comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Studying for a test?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't talk, theater major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I have a test on lighting next week that'll make your hair go grey. He sprawls on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for bailing on me last night. I had to hear Sara gab for an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you just leave? At least you can escape your problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just got my textbooks for this term. Max holds up a thick book, Post-Modern Semiology. The entire cover is a still from Annie Hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the gods give you a sign like that, there's only one thing to do. He passes a controller to Charles and they play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, I saw Julie last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was she alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if you count this huge purse she had. She was rummaging through it and finally had to dump the thing out. I swear, I'm surprised Kennedy's brain didn't fall out of that thing. Anyway, it made me think of Annie Hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Although Julie dresses better. Max slowly lowers his controller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you saying, I like her because she's like Annie Hall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God, I think you're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to like someone because she reminds me of someone in a movie. Now I'm wondering why I like her. Maybe I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good Lord, Max. Take some harder classes. Sam returns, sees what they are playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at you two. Wouldn't something else be fun for a change? How about Goldeneye?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I don't know how to play it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky for you, I actually have time to teach you. Normally I would be having lunch with Jen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit, I forgot about lunch! Max gets up and runs out. Charles and Sam exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, he'll do anything to avoid change, won't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE FABULOUS DINER  DAY 70 Beth is alone, working on a salad. Max runs up and jumps into the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not looking up) So glad you could make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm Psych now. I didn't like Soc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a Soc. major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sorry, I just meant, I needed something more, ya know, relevant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Psych is relevant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, look, I'm only in college for the degree. Most of the stuff they teach us is pointless anyway. Julie looks at Max: Say something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heheh, I bet that's why they call it "academic."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: College is a great opportunity. It's about more than getting a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's about avoiding the real world for as long as possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I work in theater, so this is great training for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You call theater the real world?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Now Julie is hitting Max's leg: Help me out here! But Max is petrified, watching his worst nightmare unfold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of us work really hard to get through school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, my parents worked their whole lives to give me the opportunity to be here. But the truth is, private schools like ours make money by showing students a good time for four years. It's bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think social work is bullshit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not what I-- CHARLES This "bullshit" is going to put me in debt for the next forty years. Julie punches Max in the thigh. He jumps, blinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just drop out if everything's such bullshit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's everybody going to order then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God. What a bunch of spoiled, whiny college brats. Nobody has anything more to say. Everyone looks away. Max is shell-shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna work for NASA!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREET OUTSIDE MAX'S DORM -- NIGHT 90 Julie's car pulls up. Her bumper sticker: "EAT ANIMALS, DON'T `LOVE' THEM" Max opens the door, gets halfway out, turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's okay. I just need a few hours to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be fun, just the two of us. Julie lights a cigarette off her old one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, see you later. She peels out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM -- NIGHT 91 Max straightens up. Scott comes out of his bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she stands you up, are we still not allowed in here? It's my time to watch "South Park."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would she do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's already past eleven. There's a KNOCK on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? Max gets the door. Scott exits, disappointed. Julie enters, smoking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Sorry I'm late. You wouldn't believe what cross-campus traffic was like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the worst excuse I ever heard. I mean it. So... you wanna hit the video store?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you've got something here that I've been looking forward to all week. She grabs Annie Hall from the shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, shit, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must face your fears. Relax, it's a very positive film. You just have to know how to look at it. It's really refreshingly positive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM -- 98 MINUTES LATER 92 The closing credits are rolling. Max and Julie look somewhat disconcerted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, what an uplifting movie. Such a refreshingly positive message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I think I prefer Manhattan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you say that? Annie Hall is so uplifting!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just deeper, more sophisticated, I guess. Listen, thanks for dinner and the movie tonight, but I should get going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's still early. Julie goes to the door. Max follows. He tries to kiss her. She pulls back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if this is a good idea right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, how about right... now? He tries to kiss her again. She ducks it, comes back into the room, sits down. Max stands, tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, since the other night, I've been doing some thinking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's your mistake. Mindless happiness is always better than thoughtful reservation. Unless you're talking about nude bungee jumping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think that this is a good time for us to jump, or leap, or whatever, you know, together. Into a relationship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, but... we just saw a movie about how relationships are worth it, no matter what happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I guess we really did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're right, Max, and this relationship was worth it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was? Is. Wait... Oh, shit! Max covers his face, breathes deep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Will you please calm down? I like you very much, but I told you, I just got out of a serious relationship, and it ended really badly. We saw each other almost every day at the beginning, but by the end of the semester, I hadn't seen him in a month. He stopped returning my calls and stuff, and I mean, he basically avoided me, then I heard he was seeing one of my friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that was him, not me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nobody's fault, I know. I mean, I've been trying but it's hard. Relationships are very difficult to maintain. There are so few successful couples.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's successful? Like, my parents have been married thirty years, but--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My parents are divorced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, bad example. But why think ahead? We're here, now. Can't we just enjoy our time together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max, I did, believe me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was all this, I mean, was any of it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what I was doing. I didn't think about where this might lead until it was too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it might lead to... happiness. Tommy walks in, half asleep, in his pajamas. He turns on the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and sits down. Max stares at him. Tommy suddenly realizes he isn't alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, re-run. He turns it off and quickly exits. Max tries to pull himself together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say something. Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew that damn film was cursed! Why did I listen to Charles instead of Annie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Max. It's not an anti-relationship movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? It's a fucking textbook. She stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not listening to me, Max. Just like you're not listening to Annie. No matter what you think right now, this was worth it. Because I got to meet you, and got to be close to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I don't know. I mean... Good-bye. Julie leaves. The VCR whirs to a stop and Annie Hall ejects. Max stares at it, upset and thoughtful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : white on black: "SUNDAY" 105.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMON ROOM -- LATE AFTERNOON 93 PAN left to right across people's chests: an X-Files shirt, a lounge shirt with a wide collar, a Stephen Hawking shirt, an Ani DiFranco shirt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to reveal, l to r, Sam, Charles, Tommy and Amanda, sprawled on the couches, from Max's POV in the doorway. They're drinking vodka out of coffee mugs. The TV is on but the sound is off. Everyone looks tired and sad. Max sits. Sam thumbs a copy of Scientific American.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are humans smarter than chimps if we have 99% of the same genetic material?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who says we're smarter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look who I'm asking. You think a red blood cell is a prison for a gang member.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very funny, Mr. Wizard. If I learned anything useful in my classes, I'd be rubbing it in your face. In Scott's usual spot is Amanda and Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Amanda. Have a good weekend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mine was good too. Get any good birthday presents?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. She gets up and leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, Max, what ever happened with that girl you were seeing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She just ended a long relationship and she doesn't want anything serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you have something that's not so serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's dead. And the thing I don't get is, it was all going so well. There was a moment when we kissed, when it was more than a kiss... His openness is making the other guys uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was like we broke through all our layers, you know, all the manners and defense mechanisms and daily crap, and I saw a flash of something, a glimmer of hope or happiness or whatever, something I inspired in her. But now it's over and I'll never see that part of her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're upset about not seeing some other parts of her again. The joke is half-hearted-- Max has made everyone reflective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a girl, Max. They'll always be a mystery. You'll never know why they love you and you'll never know why they don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relationships are incredibly complicated. Like polypeptide strings. There's an attraction at first, but if the bonds don't form right away, nothing can make the connection work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a metaphor we can all relate to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was like with Jen and I. But I know it was for the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I finally dropped out of the play I was directing, just to get rid of Sara. God, my career is in shambles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tough week all around, huh? How about some video hockey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Max gets up and puts on his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I prefer Goldeneye. He leaves. Sam sighs and picks up the remote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna watch Sports Center?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. I think I'm gonna call Sara... He gets up and leaves as Sam registers this news. He puts the remote down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPUS GREEN  DUSK 94 It is moist and foggy as Max trudges across the deserted campus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Max! Max stops in the middle of a path as Beth walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi there. Happy Valentine's Day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oo, witty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I hate Valentine's Day, too. If you're in love, you're in love. And if you're not, who wants to think about it? I want to be in love so badly, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, there's this joke...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, forget it, Max.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the joke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does a bear shit in the woods?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's the one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told it the night of our date. I hate that joke, Max. It's not a philosophy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I think I know what it means now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and it's dreary and depressing, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not this time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth, I just want to say, before it's all over and I don't have the chance, that I'm sorry. For everything. Last semester and last year. Beth is speechless; she never though she'd ever hear that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the world to me, and I was an idiot to throw it away. You were right: if I can't be a friend to you, how could I be a boyfriend? I've done a lot of things wrong, and I've been confused as hell, but I think it's time for a change. Beth looks him over, as if for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then allow me to recommend a movie that you've never seen before. It's called Annie Hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going to see it tonight. Do you want to join me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would love to, but I think you need to do this alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'll see you later?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. After the movie, I'm doing my last radio show. It's going to be all requests. You should tune in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The end of an era.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The start of a new one. He smiles and walks away. The fog begins to obscure him. Beth opens her backpack and removes a Walkman. She hits POWER and the LED changes from TAPE to RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) And that's how I let go of her. Although, it's probably more honest to say that she let go of me. Julie, Beth, and Annie. Three women in my life and I was desperate for one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Beth stands alone, watching him go. She snaps the headphones over her ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) Of course, I saw her again. It's a small campus. The last time was at a film festival. We're better friends now then ever, and there's always a chance we can have some kind of future together. So far, so good. Finally, Beth turns and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Max still walking, getting smaller and smaller. Soon all we see is fog.
direction.name: direction
